Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
dusty \dust"y\ (d[u^]st"[y^]), a. [Compar. {Dustier} (d[u^]st"[i^]*[~e]r); superl. {Dustiest} (d[u^]st"[i^]*[e^]st).] [AS. dystig. See {Dust}.] 1. Filled, covered, or sprinkled with dust; clouded with dust; as, a dusty table; a dusty attic; also, reducing to dust. [1913 Webster]
And all our yesterdays have lighted fools The way to dusty death. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
2. Like dust; of the color of dust; as, a dusty white. [1913 Webster]
{Dusty miller} (Bot.), a plant ({Cineraria maritima}); -- so called because of the ashy-white coating of its leaves. [1913 Webster]
dusty adj : covered with a layer of dusty; "a dusty pile of books" [syn: {dust-covered}] [also: {dustiest}, {dustier}]
